summary: The United States is pursuing the development of its domestic chip industry using strategies focused on isolation and protectionism. This approach contrasts with the collaborative model that facilitated the growth of the chip industry in Asia.
titles: The perils of Trump's chips strategy: the US will struggle to take on Asia

titles: Ailin Perez shrugs off Nora Cornolle's callout at UFC 314

title: United Airlines Stock Jumps as Revenue Hits Record High
snippets:
United Airlines (UAL) reported it swung to a profit in the first quarter as revenue hit a record high, sending shares surging in extended trading Tuesday.

The Chicago-based carrier posted first-quarter revenue of $13.2 billion, up 5% year-over-year and above the analyst consensus from Visible Alpha. Adjusted net income of $302 million, or 91 cents per share, compared to a loss of $50 million, or 15 cents per share, a year earlier, and also topped Wall Street’s estimates. 

United shares jumped nearly 7% in after-hours trading. The stock has lost nearly a third of its value so far in 2025 through Tuesday’s close. 

United Says It Expects 'Resilient' Earnings in Q2

The results come amid an uncertain economic environment for airlines. Last week, Visual Approach Analytics warned that air travel could face "demand destruction" as a result of the Trump administration's tariff policies, and rival carrier Delta (DAL) withdrew its full-year outlook, citing “current uncertainty."

Looking ahead, United said it expects "resilient earnings" in the second quarter and full fiscal year, despite macroeconomic challenges. The airline said it plans to reduce off-peak flying on lower-demand days.
summary: United Airlines reported a significant profit in the first quarter, with revenue reaching a record $13.2 billion, a 5% increase from the previous year. This performance exceeded analyst expectations, with adjusted net income at $302 million, or 91 cents per share, compared to a loss the previous year. Following the announcement, United's shares saw a nearly 7% increase in after-hours trading, despite a significant loss in value throughout 2025. The airline anticipates resilient earnings in the upcoming quarter and the full year, planning to adjust its flight schedule to reduce off-peak flying
titles: United Airlines Stock Jumps as Revenue Hits Record High

title: US wants to retain key tariffs on EU, say European officials

This approach is part of broader efforts to strengthen domestic industries by potentially imposing taxes or tariffs that would encourage the return of manufacturing and production processes to the United States.
titles: US wants to retain key tariffs on EU, say European officials

title: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Netflix Shares Surge as Report Reveals Ambitious Goals
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • The S&P 500 slipped 0.2% on Tuesday, April 15 amid a relative lull in market-moving global trade developments.
  • Netflix stock pushed higher after a report indicated that the streaming giant aims to double its revenue by 2030.
  • Numerous analysts reduced their price targets on Albemarle stock, citing a challenging macroeconomic backdrop, and shares of the lithium producer tumbled.


Major U.S. equities declined slightly Tuesday, a reprieve from the trade-related volatility that has driven significant swings in stocks in recent weeks.

Market indexes ticked lower following rallies in the previous two sessions and despite strong earnings reports from some of the nation's largest banks. The S&P 500 slipped 0.2%, while the Dow lost 0.4%. The Nasdaq ended Tuesday's session with a minor loss of less than 0.1% 

Palantir Technologies (PLTR) shares surged for the second straight session, adding 6.2% on Tuesday to notch the S&P 500's top daily performance. The push higher for Palantir stock followed reports that the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) acquired an artificial intelligence (AI) military solution developed by the big data analytic software firm.

Shares of Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) gained 5.1% after Bloomberg reported that activist investor Elliott Investment Management has accumulated a position worth more than $1.5 billion in the IT services provider. People familiar with the matter told Investopedia that Elliott intends to engage with HPE's leadership on potential steps to boost the tech company's value.

According to The Wall Street Journal, Netflix (NFLX) executives outlined a set of optimistic objectives at a business review meeting in March. The targets include doubling the company's revenue by 2030 and achieving a $1 trillion market capitalization. Netflix shares jumped 4.8% ahead of the streaming giant's quarterly earnings report, which is set to be released Thursday afternoon.

Shares of Albemarle (ALB), the world's largest lithium producer, dropped 5.9%, falling the most of any S&P 500 constituent. The move lower came after several research firms reduced their price targets on the stock. Analysts pointed to numerous factors behind more muted forecasts for Albemarle, including the potential for trade tensions to weigh on global sales in the automotive sector, which could result in sustained pressure on prices for battery components.   

Bank of America expressed a cautious view of the chemical sector, pointing to softness in cyclical demand and headwinds related to global trade. Analysts indicated that these factors are contributing to lower levels of confidence around upcoming earnings estimates. BofA downgraded Dow (DOW) stock to "underperform" from "buy," and shares of the chemicals giant lost 4.0% following the double downgrade.

Shares of Molina Healthcare (MOH) sank 3.8% after Baird analysts downgraded the stock to "neutral" from "outperform." According to the analyst team, companies in the managed care and health care facilities industries could be unlikely to increase their guidance in the near term given policy uncertainties related to Medicare Part D programs.
summary: On April 15, U.S. stock markets experienced a slight decline, with the S&P 500 dropping 0.2%, the Dow losing 0.4%, and the Nasdaq nearly unchanged with a minor loss of less than 0.1%. This movement came despite recent strong earnings reports from major banks and a pause in trade-related market volatility. Netflix shares rose 4.8% amid plans to double revenue by 2030, while Palantir Technologies saw a 6.2% increase after a deal with NATO. Conversely, Albemarle shares fell 5.9% due to reduced price targets amid concerns over global trade tensions affecting the automotive sector. Additionally, Ba
titles: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Netflix Shares Surge as Report Reveals Ambitious Goals

title: First ever confirmed image of a colossal squid in the deep ocean
snippets: The colossal squid is the largest invertebrate on the planet, but it is also surprisingly elusive. An image of a 30-centimetre-long juvenile is our first glimpse of the animal in its natural habitat
summary: Scientists have captured the first image of a juvenile colossal squid in its natural habitat. Measuring 30 centimeters long, this sighting is significant as the colossal squid, known as the largest invertebrate on Earth, remains highly elusive. This marks a rare observation of the species in its natural environment.
titles: First ever confirmed image of a colossal squid in the deep ocean

title: Drought may have sped the demise of Rapa Nui sculpture culture
snippets: A decades-long stretch of extremely low precipitation in the 1500s may have spurred cultural changes among the Rapa Nui people that reduced time spent building statues, but not all archaeologists agree
summary: In the 1500s, a significant drought on Rapa Nui possibly led to cultural shifts, resulting in the local population reducing the time dedicated to constructing their iconic statues. However, this theory is not universally accepted among archaeologists.
titles: Drought may have sped the demise of Rapa Nui sculpture culture

title: One-off gene-editing therapy could permanently lower cholesterol
snippets: In an early-stage trial, a single dose of a CRISPR treatment lowered cholesterol levels, possibly permanently
summary: In an early-stage clinical trial, a one-time administration of a CRISPR-based treatment was found to reduce cholesterol levels, with the potential for these reductions to be permanent. This marks a significant advancement in the application of gene-editing technology for treating conditions related to high cholesterol.
titles: One-off gene-editing therapy could permanently lower cholesterol

title: A visual pathway in the brain may do more than recognize objects
snippets: A new study questions the longstanding view that the visual system is divided into two pathways, one for object-recognition and the other for spatial tasks. Using computational vision models, researchers found the ventral visual stream, may not be exclusively optimized for object recognition.
summary: A recent study challenges the traditional belief that the visual system has two distinct pathways for processing object recognition and spatial tasks. Through the use of computational vision models, researchers discovered that the ventral visual stream, previously thought to be solely focused on object recognition, may also play a role in spatial task processing. This finding suggests a more integrated function of the visual system than previously understood.
titles: A visual pathway in the brain may do more than recognize objects

title: Explainable AI for ship navigation raises trust, decreases human error
snippets: A team has developed an explainable AI model for automatic collision avoidance between ships.
summary: A team has created an explainable artificial intelligence (AI) model designed to prevent collisions between ships automatically. This AI model aims to enhance maritime safety by providing clear, understandable reasoning behind its decisions, allowing for more reliable and transparent navigation assistance.
titles: Explainable AI for ship navigation raises trust, decreases human error
